topic: antarcticaâ€™s oldest, largest iceberg is turning an ominous blue color

text: Scientists are observing a mysterious transformation in Antarctica's oldest and largest iceberg.
The iceberg has been a part of the Antarctic landscape for decades.
A recent color change has sparked widespread concern and curiosity among researchers.
The iceberg's dimensions are approximately 100 kilometers long and 30 kilometers wide.
Satellite imagery has confirmed the iceberg's color change.
Experts believe the blue coloration is likely due to a type of algae.
The exact cause of this sudden change is still not fully understood.
The iceberg is currently located in the Weddell Sea.
The Weddell Sea is known for its harsh and unpredictable climate.
Scientists have been monitoring the iceberg's movement and condition closely.
The iceberg's movement can have significant impacts on the surrounding ecosystem.
The color change may be a sign of a larger environmental issue.
Further study is needed to determine the implications of this unusual event.
The investigation into the iceberg's color change continues.
